intro: Alyxia margaretae var. acutifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
